page.title: 10Dialect of Fletchertown area
page.content:
These are some of the words which we use in this part of Cumbria. My list of dialect words and their translation:'yaw_sheep,lamped_jumped, awert_over,yat_gate,ay_yes, lonning_lane,dyke_hedge,scop_throw, spugees_sparrows,yan_one,fower_four, tan_two,tether_three,bait_lunch, mer_more,how do_hello,fre_from, sen_look,nowt_nothing,buots_boots, breed_bread,beaker_baker,speed_spade.' Can you understand these?
'T'yaw lamped owert yat.' (The sheep jumped over the gate)
''I scopt a styen awert't'dyke.' (I threw a stone over the hedge.)
'Hey thee fetch me buots.' (Hey you bring my boots.)
